In Islamic finance, this is the simplest financing method. Two (or more) people pool their resources in a joint venture, participate in its management, and share the profits and losses on a pre-determined basis.
In Islamic finance, it is also known as the Commenda in Europe. This form of financing operates as a kind of mutual fund. One party puts up the capital, the other puts in the entrepreneurial skill.
In Islamic finance, the financier acts as the purchasing agent for the borrower, and then sells the goods to the borrower with a fixed mark-up on the purchase price.

questions.text: Which of the following statements best represents Keynes' view on the capitalist economy during the Great Depression?
options: The capitalist economy is always stable and will eventually achieve equilibrium without government intervention.
The capitalist economy is inherently stable but may experience short-term fluctuations that are self-correcting.
#The capitalist economy is inherently unstable and may experience persistent unemployment or severe inflation without government intervention.
The capitalist economy is always unstable and requires constant government intervention to achieve equilibrium.

questions.text: What is the principle of effective demand in Keynesian theory?
options: The idea that supply creates its own demand
The belief that government intervention is unnecessary in achieving full employment
The notion that the economy is inherently stable and always self-correcting
#The concept that aggregate demand equals aggregate supply

By the level of income distribution in the economy

questions.text: What does the term "marginal propensity to consume" refer to?

The rate of interest on loans.
